description: This module introduces students to writing for health communication. Creating effective health messages is a critical process that equips the public with essential information to respond appropriately to health issues. Increasingly, health communicators are addressing audiences on new media platforms, using techniques that have transformed traditional writing practices. This advanced writing seminar will explicate the task of writing strategic health messages using new media. By the end of this course, students will know to write and design effective messages for health promotion and interventions.
title: Writing for Health Communication and New Media
prerequisite:
Cohort 2011 and before:
Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in NM, with a minimum CAP of 3.50 or be on the Honours track.

Cohort 2012 onwards:
Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in NM, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
